force:org:display.description:
get the description for the current or target org
Output includes your access token, client Id, connected status, org ID, instance URL, username, and alias, if applicable.
Use --verbose to include the SFDX auth URL.
Including --verbose displays the sfdxAuthUrl property only if you authenticated to the org using auth:web:login (not auth:jwt:grant)

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: emit additional command output to stdout

force:org:list.description: list all orgs you’ve created or authenticated to

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: list more information about each org

all.name: all
all.description: include expired, deleted, and unknown-status scratch orgs

clean.name: clean
clean.description: remove all local org authorizations for non-active orgs

skipconnectionstatus.name: skipconnectionstatus
skipconnectionstatus.description: skip retrieving the connection status of non-scratch orgs

force:org:open.description:
open your default scratch org, or another specified org
To open a specific page, specify the portion of the URL after "yourInstance.salesforce.com/" as --path.
For example, specify "--path lightning" to open Lightning Experience, or specify "--path /apex/YourPage" to open a Visualforce page.
To generate a URL but not launch it in your browser, specify --urlonly.
To open in a specific browser, use the --browser parameter. Supported browsers are "chrome", "edge", and "firefox". If you don't specify --browser, the org opens in your default browser.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

urlonly.name: urlonly
urlonly.description: display navigation URL, but don’t launch browser
